quotes.quote: A cup of coffee â€“ real coffee â€“ home-browned, home ground, home made, that comes to you dark as a hazel-eye, but changes to a golden bronze as you temper it with cream that never cheated, but was real cream from its birth, thick, tenderly yellow, perfectly sweet, neither lumpy nor frothing on the Java:Â such a cup of coffee is a match for twenty blue devils and will exorcise them all.
Coffee is a hug in a mug.
Up to a thousand milligrams of caffeine is considered safe for most people, which translates into about 10 cups of coffee a day.
Even bad coffee is betterâ€¦ than no Coffee at all.
Coffee, the finest organic suspension ever devised.
The second cup of coffee is never as good as the first.
As long as there was coffee in the world, how bad could things be?
If it ain't caffeinated, it ain't coffee!

Most of the people don't know that one of the great qualities of caffeine is it allows you to absorb nutrients, and it does it quickly, and so when it does it quickly, you focus, and when you focus, you think you have energy.
Coffee smells like freshly ground heaven.
Coffee makes us severe, and grave, and philosophical.
Adventure in life is good; consistency in coffee even better.
Caffeine dehydrates the brain and body.
Widespread caffeine use explains a lot about the twentieth century.
Coffee makes dreams come true.
Coffee smiles us into the day.
Caffeine restricts blood flow to the brain.
Coffee is a beverage that puts one to sleep when not drank.
Good Coffee â€“ Cheaper than Prozac!

Coffee is a lot more than just a drink; it's something happening. Not as in hip, but like an event, a place to be, but not like a location, but like somewhere within yourself. It gives you time, but not actual hours or minutes, but a chance to be, like be yourself, and have a second cup.
Coffee makes grisly mornings bearable.
Coffee is a way of stealing time which should by rights belong to your older self.
Caffeine isn't a drug, it's a vitamin!
You can survive up to three weeks without food. You can only survive for three days without water. No one knows how many days you can survive without caffeine.
Certainly the caffeine in coffee, whether it's Starbucks or generic coffee, is somewhat of a stimulant. But if you drink it in moderation, which I think four or five cups a day is, you're fine.
No coffee can be good in the mouth that does not first send a sweet offering of odor to the nostrils.
There's nothing sweeter than a cup of bitter coffee.
What goes best with a cup of coffee? Another cup.Â
Coffee is a language in itself.
Coffee is the best thing to douse the sunrise with.
